cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly west-northwest across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to skirt southern Hispaniola, near Jamaica/eastern Cuba Sunday, then turn into the Florida Straits and eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida west coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida west coast / eastern Gulf coast (Big Bend area most likely)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches for Grenada and its dependencies, Saba & Sint Eustatius, Jamaica, and Dominica
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings for Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & the Grenadines; Tropical Storm Warnings for Martinique, the southern coast of the Dominican Republic, and the entire coast of Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward Islands, southern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, southern Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba, Florida peninsula and Gulf coast
weather_observation.wind: Brief periods of tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Monday into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of southeast Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could bring 1–3 inches, localized 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and short-period swells could disrupt pilot operations and cruise/fuel berthing
